issue.title: [CF 730] Ox/Serpent Stance & Power Bar Overlay
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
the "power bar overlay" does not work for the Monk skill Jab when in Ox and Serpent Stance. This also seems to be the case for other skills that have no cooldown and require x energy/mana (e.g. Spinning Crane Kick). In Tiger stance however, it is working fine.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
expected: to see the energy missing to be able to cast the skill
instead: when in Ox/Serpent stance, the icon is stuck in the "usable"-state, even when "Power check" is true and my energy is below 40 (or below the skill's mana cost)

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v 6.1.1

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
this is the icon I'm using:
^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Scooldown ^SShowTimerText^B ^SManaCheck^B ^SClockGCD^B ^SShowPBar^B ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SUnAlpha^N0.5 ^SEnabled^B ^SName^SJab ^SRangeCheck^B ^t^N61103^S~`~| ^Sicon^^


> Posted by CurseForge user _dAda | Imported from CurseForge issue #730 | Raw

comments.body:
I can implement a crude fix for the Power Check setting not working with this, but I can't for the power bar not working. The problem is that for some reason, Blizzard's API reports Jab as having no cost while in certain stances (it is only happening with tiger stance for me. Ox stance works fine), so the power bar is no way of knowing its maximum value.

I will submit a bug report to Blizzard, but who knows if they will ever fix it.

Edited Dec 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Bug report on the forums, for reference: http://us.battle.net/wow/en/forum/topic/7393479299


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

thanks! for anyone interested: I made a workaround for the powerbar, it doesn't show a bar but instead your energy value if lower than 40. It's not as intuitive as the power bar but at least it's something:

^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Sconditionicon ^SClockGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STexts^T ^N1^S[MP(unit="player"):Hide(MP(unit="player")`>=`40)] ^t^t^t^SShowWhen^N3 ^SCustomTex^S100780 ^SUnAlpha^N0.5 ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SSPELLRANGE ^SUnit^Starget ^SName^SJab ^t^N2^T ^SType^SENERGY_ABS ^SOperator^S>= ^SLevel^N40 ^t^Sn^N2 ^t^SEnabled^B ^t^N61103^S`| ^Sicon^^

oh and Cybeloras, maybe also mention in your bugreport that it also seems to happen with other skills that cost energy (e.g. SCK). I can't do it myself because I'm EU

Edited Dec 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user _dAda

Ok, I added that to the bug report.

Just something to note about your tag, though, is that you can do [MP(unit="player") >= 40] and it will have the same functionality.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
